elements.content: Two three-dimensional 2p−3d−4f heterometallic frameworks featuring a nanosized Ln6Cu24Na12 (Ln = Gd, Dy) cluster as a node have been obtained under microwave irradiation conditions through the reaction of H2ANMA (H2ANMA = l-alanine-N-monoacetic acid), Cu(NO3)2, and Ln(NO3)3 (Ln = Gd for 1, Dy for 2) with NaOH in deionized water. Investigations on the magnetic properties show that 1 exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior. The electrical conductivity measurements reveal that 1 behaves as a proton conductor.
elements.clean_text: Two three-dimensional 2p-3d-4f heterometallic frameworks featuring a nanosized Ln6Cu24Na12 (Ln = Gd, Dy) cluster as a node have been obtained under microwave irradiation conditions through the reaction of H2ANMA (H2ANMA = l-alanine-N-monoacetic acid), Cu(NO3)2, and Ln(NO3)3 (Ln = Gd for 1, Dy for 2) with NaOH in deionized water. Investigations on the magnetic properties show that 1 exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior. The electrical conductivity measurements reveal that 1 behaves as a proton conductor.

elements.content: Two nanoscale Ln6Cu24Na12 cluster-based three-dimensional 2p−3d−4f heterometallic frameworks have been synthesized under microwave irradiation conditions. Magnetic and electric property measurements show that the Gd6Cu24Na12-based framework exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior and proton conductivity.
elements.clean_text: Two nanoscale Ln6Cu24Na12 cluster-based three-dimensional 2p-3d-4f heterometallic frameworks have been synthesized under microwave irradiation conditions. Magnetic and electric property measurements show that the Gd6Cu24Na12-based framework exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior and proton conductivity.

elements.content: Heterometallic clusters have attracted enormous interest because of their extraordinary chemical and physical properties such as magnetism, luminescence, and electricity, which could provide an impetus for application of these solids in the field of materials science. So far, a great variety of discrete heterometallic polynuclear complexes have been obtained either rationally or fortuitously. Recently, the use of the heterometallic cluster as a building block to construct multidimensional frameworks is a most notable field. Compared with single metal ions, heterometallic cluster-based polymers not only have larger pore sizes but also can incorporate desired functionalities from the clusters and frameworks. Nonetheless, owing to the synthetic difficulty, heterometallic cluster-based, especially high-nuclearity-based, frameworks are still very rare, which obstructs further studies of their physical and chemical properties.
elements.clean_text: Heterometallic clusters have attracted enormous interest because of their extraordinary chemical and physical properties such as magnetism, luminescence, and electricity, which could provide an impetus for application of these solids in the field of materials science. So far, a great variety of discrete heterometallic polynuclear complexes have been obtained either rationally or fortuitously. Recently, the use of the heterometallic cluster as a building block to construct multidimensional frameworks is a most notable field. Compared with single metal ions, heterometallic cluster-based polymers not only have larger pore sizes but also can incorporate desired functionalities from the clusters and frameworks. Nonetheless, owing to the synthetic difficulty, heterometallic cluster-based, especially high-nuclearity-based, frameworks are still very rare, which obstructs further studies of their physical and chemical properties.

elements.content: An effective synthetic strategy for heterometallic cluster-based frameworks is to select flexible and chelate-bridged ligands with an appropriate auxiliary group as the linker. Following this idea, we have obtained a series of 3d−4f heterometallic cluster-based frameworks based on the derivates of iminodiacetic acid under hydrothermal conditions. Here, on the basis of the reaction of l-alanine-N-monoacetic acid (H2ANMA), Cu(NO3)2·3H2O, and Ln(NO3)3·6H2O (Ln = Gd for 1, Dy for 2) under microwave irradiation conditions, we report two novel three-dimensional (3D) 2p−3d−4f heterometallic coordination polymers, [Ln6Cu24Na12(ANMA)12(μ3-OH)24(μ5-O)6Cl(H2O)42](NO3)13Cl4(H2O)48 (Ln = Gd for 1, Dy for 2). Notably, 1 and 2 are rare examples of 3D heterometallic frameworks constructed by high-nuclearity 2p−3d−4f clusters.
elements.clean_text: An effective synthetic strategy for heterometallic cluster-based frameworks is to select flexible and chelate-bridged ligands with an appropriate auxiliary group as the linker. Following this idea, we have obtained a series of 3d-4f heterometallic cluster-based frameworks based on the derivates of iminodiacetic acid under hydrothermal conditions. Here, on the basis of the reaction of l-alanine-N-monoacetic acid (H2ANMA), Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O, and Ln(NO3)3⋅6H2O (Ln = Gd for 1, Dy for 2) under microwave irradiation conditions, we report two novel three-dimensional (3D) 2p-3d-4f heterometallic coordination polymers, [Ln6Cu24Na12(ANMA)12(μ3-OH)24(μ5-O)6Cl(H2O)42](NO3)13Cl4(H2O)48 (Ln = Gd for 1, Dy for 2). Notably, 1 and 2 are rare examples of 3D heterometallic frameworks constructed by high-nuclearity 2p-3d-4f clusters.

elements.content: Complex 1 was crystallized in the R3̅ space group. Figure a shows the cation cluster core Gd6Cu24Na12 of 1, while the asymmetric unit is depicted in Figure b. The Gd6Cu24Na12 core is composed of the Gd6Cu12 octahedral inner core and six outer Na2Cu2 square units. The inner Gd6Cu12 core can be well described as an octahedron with pseudocubic O h symmetry, which is similar to those reported by the Chen and Wu groups. Six Gd3+ ions locate six vertexes of the octahedron, and 12 Cu2+ ions hold the midpoints of the octahedral edges. The Gd−Cu metal framework is interconnected by 24 μ3-OH− ligands, with each one bridging with two inner Cu2+ ions and one Gd3+ ion. Each face of the octahedron consists of three Gd3+ ions and three Cu2+ ions linked by three μ3-OH− groups.
elements.clean_text: Complex 1 was crystallized in the R3̅ space group. Figure a shows the cation cluster core Gd6Cu24Na12 of 1, while the asymmetric unit is depicted in Figure b. The Gd6Cu24Na12 core is composed of the Gd6Cu12 octahedral inner core and six outer Na2Cu2 square units. The inner Gd6Cu12 core can be well described as an octahedron with pseudocubic O  h  symmetry, which is similar to those reported by the Chen and Wu groups. Six Gd3+ ions locate six vertexes of the octahedron, and 12 Cu2+ ions hold the midpoints of the octahedral edges. The Gd-Cu metal framework is interconnected by 24 μ3-OH- ligands, with each one bridging with two inner Cu2+ ions and one Gd3+ ion. Each face of the octahedron consists of three Gd3+ ions and three Cu2+ ions linked by three μ3-OH- groups.

elements.content: (a) Crystal structure of [Gd6Cu24Na12] cation. (b) Asymmetric unit of 1. (c) [Gd6Cu24Na12(μ3-OH)24(μ5-O)6] cation core of 1. (d) Polyhedron view of [Gd6Cu24Na12].
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) Crystal structure of [Gd6Cu24Na12] cation. (b) Asymmetric unit of 1. (c) [Gd6Cu24Na12(μ3-OH)24(μ5-O)6] cation core of 1. (d) Polyhedron view of [Gd6Cu24Na12].

elements.content: An outer tetranuclear Na2Cu2 cluster unit can be well described as a square. Two outer Cu2+ ions locate two adjacent vertexes of the square and two Na+ ions positioned at the other two vertexes. One μ5-O2− ligand locates in the square center linking four outer metal ions and one inner Gd3+ ion. Four μ2-H2O ligands locate outboard of the square and link adjacent metal ions. Each outer Cu2+ ion links one Gd3+ ion and one inner Cu2+ ion by the carboxyl of the ANMA2− ligand in a syn−anti mode. Each Na+ ion is connected with one Gd3+ ion by one μ2-H2O bridge. It is noteworthy that a chlorine ion, which plays an important role as a template, is enveloped in the center of the octahedral cage.
elements.clean_text: An outer tetranuclear Na2Cu2 cluster unit can be well described as a square. Two outer Cu2+ ions locate two adjacent vertexes of the square and two Na+ ions positioned at the other two vertexes. One μ5-O2- ligand locates in the square center linking four outer metal ions and one inner Gd3+ ion. Four μ2-H2O ligands locate outboard of the square and link adjacent metal ions. Each outer Cu2+ ion links one Gd3+ ion and one inner Cu2+ ion by the carboxyl of the ANMA2- ligand in a syn-anti mode. Each Na+ ion is connected with one Gd3+ ion by one μ2-H2O bridge. It is noteworthy that a chlorine ion, which plays an important role as a template, is enveloped in the center of the octahedral cage.

elements.content: The coordination geometry of the nonacoordinate Gd3+ ion is well described as a monocapped square antiprism, featuring coordination by four μ3-OH− groups, two carboxylate oxygen atoms, one μ5-O2− atom, and two μ2-H2O ligands. The inner Cu2+ ion is pentacoordinated, featuring quadrilateral pyramid coordination symmetry by four μ3-OH− groups and one carboxyl oxygen atom, while the coordination mode of the outer Cu2+ ion is regarded as octahedron, which derives from the contribution of one ANMA2− ligand in a tridentate fashion, two μ2-H2O ligands, and one μ5-O2− atom. The Na+ ion is hexacoordinated, featuring the contribution of five aqua ligands and one μ5-O2− atom. The bond lengths of Gd−O, Na−O, Cu−O, and Cu−N in 1 are 2.424(4)−2.571(8), 1.851(5)−2.716(13), 1.927(5)−2.386(9), and 1.958(12)−2.040(12) Å, respectively, comparable to those in the reported compounds. The distances of Gd3+···Cu2+ and Cu2+···Cu2+ are 3.4818(7)−3.5037(7) and 3.2286(2)−3.3731(9) Å, respectively, and each pair of Gd3+ ions is separated by a distance of 6.9812(4) Å. Each ANMA2− ligand chelates one outer Cu2+ in a tridentate fashion and links one Na+ ion from an adjacent building block.
elements.clean_text: The coordination geometry of the nonacoordinate Gd3+ ion is well described as a monocapped square antiprism, featuring coordination by four μ3-OH- groups, two carboxylate oxygen atoms, one μ5-O2- atom, and two μ2-H2O ligands. The inner Cu2+ ion is pentacoordinated, featuring quadrilateral pyramid coordination symmetry by four μ3-OH- groups and one carboxyl oxygen atom, while the coordination mode of the outer Cu2+ ion is regarded as octahedron, which derives from the contribution of one ANMA2- ligand in a tridentate fashion, two μ2-H2O ligands, and one μ5-O2- atom. The Na+ ion is hexacoordinated, featuring the contribution of five aqua ligands and one μ5-O2- atom. The bond lengths of Gd-O, Na-O, Cu-O, and Cu-N in 1 are 2.424(4)-2.571(8), 1.851(5)-2.716(13), 1.927(5)-2.386(9), and 1.958(12)-2.040(12) Å, respectively, comparable to those in the reported compounds. The distances of Gd3+⋅⋅⋅Cu2+ and Cu2+⋅⋅⋅Cu2+ are 3.4818(7)-3.5037(7) and 3.2286(2)-3.3731(9) Å, respectively, and each pair of Gd3+ ions is separated by a distance of 6.9812(4) Å. Each ANMA2- ligand chelates one outer Cu2+ in a tridentate fashion and links one Na+ ion from an adjacent building block.

elements.content: (a) Polyhedral view of the 3D metal framework of 1. (b) Topology of the 3D structure.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) Polyhedral view of the 3D metal framework of 1. (b) Topology of the 3D structure.

elements.content: The inspection of 3D frameworks of 1 reveals that Gd6Cu24Na12 as a six-connected building block is linked to adjacent ones by the ANMA2− ligand, generating extended solids with the Schläfli symbol (4, 4) topology (Figure ). Owing to disorder, 48 guest water molecules, 5 NO3 −, and 4 Cl− ions are removed by SQUEEZE. The pore volume of the framework 1 calculated through the PLATON program is approximately 15 685 Å3 per unit cell volume (57.3%).
elements.clean_text: The inspection of 3D frameworks of 1 reveals that Gd6Cu24Na12 as a six-connected building block is linked to adjacent ones by the ANMA2- ligand, generating extended solids with the Schläfli symbol (4, 4) topology (Figure ). Owing to disorder, 48 guest water molecules, 5 NO3 -, and 4 Cl- ions are removed by SQUEEZE. The pore volume of the framework 1 calculated through the PLATON program is approximately 15685 Å3 per unit cell volume (57.3%).

elements.content: Complex 2 is isomorphic to 1. The bond lengths of Dy−O, Na−O, Cu−O, and Cu−N in 2 are 2.392(5)−2.569(7), 1.863(5)−2.798(17), 1.934(4)−2.339(8), and 1.920(9)−1.987(10) Å, respectively, slightly shorter than those in 1. The distances of Dy3+···Cu2+ and Cu2+···Cu2+ are 3.4577(6)−3.4910(6) and 3.2176(15)−3.3766(8) Å, and each pair of Dy3+ ions is separated by a distance of 6.9481(4) Å.
elements.clean_text: Complex 2 is isomorphic to 1. The bond lengths of Dy-O, Na-O, Cu-O, and Cu-N in 2 are 2.392(5)-2.569(7), 1.863(5)-2.798(17), 1.934(4)-2.339(8), and 1.920(9)-1.987(10) Å, respectively, slightly shorter than those in 1. The distances of Dy3+⋅⋅⋅Cu2+ and Cu2+⋅⋅⋅Cu2+ are 3.4577(6)-3.4910(6) and 3.2176(15)-3.3766(8) Å, and each pair of Dy3+ ions is separated by a distance of 6.9481(4) Å.

elements.content: The temperature dependence of the magnetic susceptibility of 1 was measured from 1.8 to 300 K with an applied magnetic field of 1000 Oe. As shown in Figure , the χM T value of 1 at room temperature is 60.69 cm3 mol−1 K (300 K), which is consistent with the expected value of 56.25 cm3 mol−1 K for 6 independent Gd3+ ions (8S 7/2, g = 2.0) and 24 independent Cu2+ ions (g = 2.0). As the temperature decreases, the value of χM T decreases slowly and reaches a value of 55.04 cm3 mol−1 K at 50.0 K. Upon further lowering of the temperature, the value of χM T increases abruptly and reaches a maximum of 65.43 cm3 mol−1 K at 6 K, in which 1 exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior. Inspection of the structure of 1 reveals that the overall ferrimagnetic behavior may be derived from the integrated result of ferromagnetic coupling between Gd3+ and inner Cu2+ ions, ferromagnetic coupling between inner and outer Cu2+ ions bridged by syn−anti carboxylate, and antiferromagnetic coupling between outer Cu2+ ions. Upon further lowering of the temperature, the value of χM T decreases rapidly and reaches a value of 58.27 cm3 mol−1 K at 2 K, which may be ascribed to an antiferromagnetic interaction between the clusters. The data over the temperature range of 100−300 K fit well the Curie−Weiss law with Weiss constant C = 12.38 cm3 mol−1 K and Curie constant θ = −0.13 K, which is consistent with the overall weak antiferromagnetic behavior. Magnetization has come to saturation at an applied magnetic field of 4 T (Figure S1 in the , SI).
elements.clean_text: The temperature dependence of the magnetic susceptibility of 1 was measured from 1.8 to 300 K with an applied magnetic field of 1000 Oe. As shown in Figure , the χM T value of 1 at room temperature is 60.69 cm3 mol-1 K (300 K), which is consistent with the expected value of 56.25 cm3 mol-1 K for 6 independent Gd3+ ions (8S 7/2, g = 2.0) and 24 independent Cu2+ ions (g = 2.0). As the temperature decreases, the value of χM T decreases slowly and reaches a value of 55.04 cm3 mol-1 K at 50.0 K. Upon further lowering of the temperature, the value of χM T increases abruptly and reaches a maximum of 65.43 cm3 mol-1 K at 6 K, in which 1 exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior. Inspection of the structure of 1 reveals that the overall ferrimagnetic behavior may be derived from the integrated result of ferromagnetic coupling between Gd3+ and inner Cu2+ ions, ferromagnetic coupling between inner and outer Cu2+ ions bridged by syn-anti carboxylate, and antiferromagnetic coupling between outer Cu2+ ions. Upon further lowering of the temperature, the value of χM T decreases rapidly and reaches a value of 58.27 cm3 mol-1 K at 2 K, which may be ascribed to an antiferromagnetic interaction between the clusters. The data over the temperature range of 100-300 K fit well the Curie-Weiss law with Weiss constant C = 12.38 cm3 mol-1 K and Curie constant θ = -0.13 K, which is consistent with the overall weak antiferromagnetic behavior. Magnetization has come to saturation at an applied magnetic field of 4 T (Figure S1 in the , SI).

elements.content: Plots of χM T vs T (denoted as ○) and a red solid line fitted for χM −1 vs T (denoted as ◻) of 1.
elements.clean_text: 3  Plots of χM T vs T (denoted as ○) and a red solid line fitted for χM -1 vs T (denoted as ◻) of 1.

elements.content: Magnetic analysis reveals that the antiferromagnetic coupling of outer Cu2+ ions in complex 2 are slightly stronger (Figure S2 in the ), which can be supported by slightly shorter Cu2+···Cu2+ bond lengths.
elements.clean_text: Magnetic analysis reveals that the antiferromagnetic coupling of outer Cu2+ ions in complex 2 are slightly stronger (Figure S2 in the ), which can be supported by slightly shorter Cu2+⋅⋅⋅Cu2+ bond lengths.

elements.content: In order to investigate the electrical property of 1, alternating-current (ac) impedance measurements were performed. Figure shows Nyquist plots of 1 at various temperatures. At low frequencies, the Nyquist plots show semicircles, which were fitted by a semicircular equation. The conductance value (σ) of 1 is 1.36 × 10−6 S cm−1 at 318 K. With an increase of the temperature, the conductance value decreases and reaches 0.84 × 10−6 S cm−1 at 328 K, 0.44 × 10−6 S cm−1 at 338 K, 0.16 × 10−6 S cm−1 at 348 K, and 0.04 × 10−6 S cm−1 at 358 K. The Nyquist plot almost becomes a beeline at 368 K. A powder X-ray diffraction study at different temperatures and thermogravimetric analysis (Figure S3 and S4 in the ) reveal that the 3D framework of 1 is maintained during the ac impedance measurements. Thus, a decrease of the conductance value is attributed to the removal of guest water molecules. The origin of conductivity may be derived from transfer of a proton, where guest water molecules act as suppliers of protons.

At low frequencies, the Nyquist plots show semicircles, which were fitted by a semicircular equation. The conductance value (σ) of 1 is 1.36 × 10-6 S cm-1 at 318 K. With an increase of the temperature, the conductance value decreases and reaches 0.84 × 10-6 S cm-1 at 328 K, 0.44 × 10-6 S cm-1 at 338 K, 0.16 × 10-6 S cm-1 at 348 K, and 0.04 × 10-6 S cm-1 at 358 K. The Nyquist plot almost becomes a beeline at 368 K. A powder X-ray diffraction study at different temperatures and thermogravimetric analysis (Figure S3 and S4 in the ) reveal that the 3D framework of 1 is maintained during the ac impedance measurements. Thus, a decrease of the conductance value is attributed to the removal of guest water molecules. elements.content: Nyquist plots of the ac impedance of 1 over the temperature range of 318−368 K. The solid line was fitted to experimental data (○) based on a semicircular equation.

elements.content: In summary, we reported two rare examples of 3D heterometallic frameworks constructed with a high-nuclearity Ln6Cu24Na12 cluster as a node. Magnetic measurements suggest that 1 exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior. ac impedance measurements reveal that 1 exhibits proton conductivity. The results presented herein indicate that using the high-nuclearity cluster as a building block to construct multidimensional frameworks is a feasible synthetic approach to multifunctional materials.
elements.clean_text: In summary, we reported two rare examples of 3D heterometallic frameworks constructed with a high-nuclearity Ln6Cu24Na12 cluster as a node. Magnetic measurements suggest that 1 exhibits ferrimagnetic behavior. ac impedance measurements reveal that 1 exhibits proton conductivity. The results presented herein indicate that using the high-nuclearity cluster as a building block to construct multidimensional frameworks is a feasible synthetic approach to multifunctional materials.

metadata.title: Two Three-Dimensional 2p−3d−4f Heterometallic Frameworks Featuring a Ln6Cu24Na12 Cluster as a Node
